ROYAL,

FOR THE BENEFIT OF

If* - P AXCSLOE.
who has the honor to announce to the Nobility, Gentry, and the Public, that Mr. W E B S T E R
has, in the Mvdrtt possible manner, granted the use of this Theatre, for his ANNUAL BENEFIT.
Mr. P. trials he will not be deemed egotistical in reminding them, that he was for Fourteen Years
Prompter at Covent Garden, and the three following years, in the same capacity, at Driiry Lane,
Theatres. In consequence of the depression under whh h the latter Establishment has for some
time past laboured, as an Arena for the Legitimate Drama, he has, in common with others, been
subject to the difficulties consequent upon that event. He trusts, however, that his long services will,
ON the pit sent occasion, entitle him to a proportionate share of general patronage; especially, as will
be sem, thai |l(> has been generously offered the valuable aid of some of the most Eminent Members:
of Ike Profession in addition to the'whole of the Distinguished Talent attached to this Theatre.
